simulation.engine
Class Body

java.lang.Object
  simulation.engine.Body

public final class Body
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a rigid body. It collides with other bodies.

Author:
Jacob Taylor

          Type constant that corresponds to a circle.

public static final int DEFAULT_SHAPE
Type constant that corresponds to any shape that does not fit into the other categories.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

POLYGON

public static final int POLYGON
Type constant that corresponds to a polygon; currently this is the same as DEFAULT_SHAPE.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RECTANGLE

public static final int RECTANGLE
Type constant that corresponds to a rectangle, particularly to all rectangles created by the add rectangle tool. A polygon created by some other method may actually be a rectangle, but will not necessarily be recognized as such.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Constructor Detail

Body

public Body(CollisionShape shape,
            double mass,
            java.awt.Color color,
            int type)
Creates a body with a given shape, mass, type and color.

Parameters:
shape - - the body's shape
mass - - the body's mass
color - - the color this body will be.
type - - the type of shape this is. The default is 0, specifying a number that is not defined is the same as specifying 0.

Body

public Body(CollisionShape shape,
            double mass,
            int type)
Creates a body with the given shape and mass, with a random color. The only guarantee about the color is that it will not be translucent or transparent. The shape will have the specified type.

Parameters:
shape - - the shape of the body.
mass - - the mass of the body.
type - - the type of shape this is. The default is 0, specifying a number that is not defined is the same as specifying 0.

Body

public Body(CollisionShape shape,
            double mass,
            java.awt.Color color)
Creates a body with the specified shape, mass, color as well as a the default type of 0, meaning that this is a polygon.

Parameters:
shape - - the shape of the body.
mass - - the mass of the body.
color - - the color of the body.

Body

public Body(CollisionShape shape,
            double mass)
Creates a body with the given shape and mass, with a random color. The only guarantee about the color is that it will not be translucent or transparent. This body will have the default type.

Parameters:
shape - - the shape of this body.
mass - the mass of this body.

Body

public Body(CollisionShape shape,
            java.awt.Color color,
            int type)
Creates a body with the given shape, color and type and the default density. The density is maintained by giving the body a mass equal to defaultDensity * shape.area(), where shape is the provided CollisionShape.

Parameters:
shape - - the shape of the body.
color - - the color of the body.
type - - the type of shape this is. The default is 0, specifying a number that is not defined is the same as specifying 0.

Body

public Body(CollisionShape shape,
            int type)
Creates a body with the given shape and type and the default density. The density is maintained by giving the body a mass equal to defaultDensity * shape.area() , where shape is the provided CollisionShape.

Parameters:
shape - - the shape of the body.
type - - the type of shape this is. The default is 0, specifying a number that is not defined is the same as specifying 0.

Body

public Body(CollisionShape shape,
            java.awt.Color color)
Creates a body with the given shape and color and the default density. The density is maintained by giving the body a mass equal to defaultDensity * shape.area() , where shape is the provided CollisionShape.

Parameters:
shape - - the shape of this body.
color - - the color of this body.

Body

public Body(CollisionShape shape)
Creates a body with the given shape and the default density. The density is maintained by giving the body a mass equal to defaultDensity * shape.area(), where shape is the provided CollisionShape .

Parameters:
shape - - the shape of this body.

Body

public Body(java.lang.String archiveString)
Creates a new body based on the supplied archive string. The supplied string should have been originally created by toArchiveString() or to that exact specification, otherwise this constructor will not work very well.

Parameters:
archiveString - - the string from which to recreate this body.

setFixed

public void setFixed(boolean on)
If true, makes the body fixed; if false, makes it free.

Parameters:
on - true if it should be fixed; false if not

setBounciness

public void setBounciness(double bounciness)
Set the bounciness, which determines how elastic a collision is. The value should be between 0 and 1 inclusive; if it isn't nothing will happened and no exception will be thrown.

Parameters:
bounciness - - the new bounciness

friction

public double friction()
Get the friction, which helps determine the coefficient of friction.

Returns:
the friction

setFriction

public void setFriction(double friction)
Set the friction, which helps determine the coefficient of friction. If the friction supplied is not between 0 and 1 (inclusive) then nothing will happened and no exception will be thrown.

Parameters:
friction - - the new friction; should be between 0 and 1 inclusive to take effect.

Parameters:
amount - how many time units to pass

setColor

public void setColor(java.awt.Color color)
Changes this body's color. This does not fire any events; the change will only be actually visible to the user the next time stateChanged is fired.

Parameters:
color - the color to set.

public java.awt.Color getColor()
Returns the color of this shape.

the color of this shape.

public int getType()

setMass

public void setMass(java.lang.Double mass)
Sets the mass of the body.

Parameters:
mass - - the new mass of the body.

getMass

public double getMass()
Returns the mass of this body. The mass dictates how hard the body resists acceleration. On bodies created with the tools, the mass is usually dictated by the density * the area of the body.

Returns:
the mass of the object.

setDensity

public void setDensity(double density)
Sets this body's density to a new value. The density dictates how much mass the object has depending on its area. Changing the density changes the mass.

Parameters:
density - - the new density to set.

getDensity

public double getDensity()
Returns this body's density. The density dictates how much mass the object has depending on its area. Changing the density changes the mass.

Returns:
the body's density.

getBounciness

public double getBounciness()
Returns the bounciness of this body. This is a number between 0 and 1 that determines how much energy is lost when the body bounces. A value of 0 means that the body will not bounce; a value of 1 means the body will not lose any energy when bouncing and can therefore bounce forever.

Returns:
the bounciness of this body.

getFriction

public double getFriction()
Returns the friction value of this object. This is a number between 0 and 1 that dictates how much energy is lost when the body contacts a different body.

Returns:
the friction of this body.

getVelocity

public Vector getVelocity()
Returns the current velocity of this object. This is a vector that combines the object's speed and direction.

Returns:
the velocity of the object.

getAngularVelocity

public double getAngularVelocity()
Returns the angular velocity of the object in radians / time unit. This value dictates how fast an object is spinning.

Returns:
the angular velocity of the object.

getMomentOfInertia

public double getMomentOfInertia()
Returns the body's moment of inertia.

Returns:
the body's moment of inertia.

isFixed

public boolean isFixed()
Returns whether the object is fixed. A fixed object cannot move. Walls are fixed by default.

Returns:
whether the object is fixed.

toArchiveString

public java.lang.String toArchiveString()
Returns a String that corresponds to this Body in every way, and can be used to reconstruct it at a later date. The returned String is a pipe ("|") delimited set of numbers, surrounded with square brackets that mark the boundaries of the body's definition. The order of the information that appears in the String:
  1. Type, as defined by getType()
  2. Shape -- a set of points that can yield a unique shape
  3. Mass, as defined by getMass()
  4. Bounciness -- from getBounciness()
  5. Friction -- from getFriction()
  6. Velocity -- getVelocity()
  7. Angular Velocity -- getAngularVelocity()
  8. Moment of Inertia -- getMomentOfInertia()
  9. Fixed -- whether the body is fixed. 1==true, 0==false.
  10. Color -- the body's color...

Returns:
the archive String.

addChangeListener

public void addChangeListener(javax.swing.event.ChangeListener listener)
Registers a ChangeListener with this body. The listener is notified whenever one of the body's properties changes.

Parameters:
listener - - the ChangeListener to add.

removeChangeListener

public void removeChangeListener(javax.swing.event.ChangeListener listener)
Removes the specified ChangeListener from this body. If the listener is not registered to this body, nothing happens. If the listener is registered more than once, only the first instance is removed and the rest will continue to be notified.

Parameters:
listener - - the ChangeListener to remove.

getChangeListeners

public javax.swing.event.ChangeListener[] getChangeListeners()
Returns an array of all the ChangeListeners registered to this body.

Returns:
an array of all the ChangeListeners currently registered to this body.

public java.lang.String toString()
